Plot: &#039;The Razor&#039;s Edge&#039; Bill Murray (&#039;Groundhog Day&#039;) makes an unforgettable dramatic debut as Larry Darrell, the free-spirited seeker, in this gripping adaptation of W. Somerset Maugham&#039;s classic novel. When Larry returns from World War I disillusioned with Jazz Age values, he undertakes a quest which leads him to reject his rich fiancee (Catherine Hicks, TV&#039;s &#039;7th Heaven&#039;) and his superficial lifestyle to go search for truth in the Himalayas. But Larry learns that the path to enlightenment is as difficult as treading "the sharp edge of a razor" and returns to civilization, where he tastes life&#039;s dark side when he tries to save a hometown girl turned prostitute (Theresa Russell, &#039;Wild Things&#039;).
